org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types

Class IPv6Address

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPAddress<IPv6Address>
      • org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv6Address
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<IPv6Address>, Writeable, OFValueType<IPv6Address>, PrimitiveSinkable

    public class IPv6Address
extends IPAddress<IPv6Address>
implements Writeable
    IPv6 address object. Instance controlled, immutable. Internal representation: two 64 bit longs (not that you'd have to know).
    Author:
    Andreas Wundsam <andreas.wundsam@teleteach.de>

      • isUnspecified

        public boolean isUnspecified()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns true if the IPAddress is unspecified.

        The unspecified addresses, also known as the wildcard addresses, refer to:

        • the IPv4Address of 0.0.0.0
        • the IPv6Address of ::
        Specified by:
        isUnspecified in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        true if the IPAddress is unspecified, false otherwise

      • isLoopback

        public boolean isLoopback()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns true if the IPAddress is a loopback address.

        Loopback addresses refer to:

        • any IPv4Address within 127.0.0.0/8
        • the IPv6Address of ::1
        Specified by:
        isLoopback in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        true if the IPAddress is a loopback address, false otherwise

      • isLinkLocal

        public boolean isLinkLocal()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns true if the IPAddress is a link local address.

        Link local addresses refer to:

        • any IPv4Address within 169.254.0.0/16
        • any IPv6Address within fe80::/10
        Specified by:
        isLinkLocal in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        true if the IPAddress is a link local address, false otherwise

      • isModifiedEui64Derived

        public boolean isModifiedEui64Derived(@Nonnull
                                      MacAddress macAddress)
        Returns true if the second (lower-order) 64-bit block of this address is equal to the Modified EUI-64 format interface identifier that corresponds to the specified MAC address.

        Refer to the followings for the details of conversions between MAC addresses and Modified EUI-64 format interface identifiers:

        • RFC 7042 - Section 2.2.1
        • RFC 5342 - Section 2.2.1 (Obsoleted by RFC 7042)
        • RFC 4291 - Appendix A

        This method assumes the second (lower-order) 64-bit block to be a 64-bit interface identifier, which may not always be true.

        Parameters:
        macAddress - the MAC address to check
        Returns:
        boolean true or false

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv6Address of(@Nonnull
                                      byte[] address)
        Returns an IPv6Address object that represents the given IP address. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in address[0].

        The address byte array must be 16 bytes long (128 bits long).

        Similar to InetAddress.getByAddress(byte[]).

        Parameters:
        address - the raw IP address in network byte order
        Returns:
        an IPv6Address object that represents the given raw IP address
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given address was null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given address was of an invalid byte array length
        See Also:
        InetAddress.getByAddress(byte[])

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv6Address of(@Nonnull
                                      String string)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an IPv6Address object that represents the given IP address. The argument is in the conventional string representation of IPv6 addresses.

        Expects up to 8 groups of 16-bit hex words seperated by colons (e.g., 2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348).

        Supports zero compression (e.g., 2001:db8::7348). Does not currently support embedding a dotted-quad IPv4 address into the IPv6 address (e.g., 2001:db8::192.168.0.1).

        Parameters:
        string - the IP address in the conventional string representation of IPv6 addresses
        Returns:
        an IPv6Address object that represents the given IP address
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given string was null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string was not a valid IPv6 address

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv6Address of(long raw1,
                                      long raw2)
        Returns an IPv6Address object that represents the given IP address. The arguments are the two 64-bit integers representing the first (higher-order) and second (lower-order) 64-bit blocks of the IP address.
        Parameters:
        raw1 - the first (higher-order) 64-bit block of the IP address
        raw2 - the second (lower-order) 64-bit block of the IP address
        Returns:
        an IPv6Address object that represents the given raw IP address

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv6Address of(@Nonnull
                                      Inet6Address address)
        Returns an IPv6Address object that represents the given IP address. The argument is given as an Inet6Address object.
        Parameters:
        address - the IP address as an Inet6Address object
        Returns:
        an IPv6Address object that represents the given IP address
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given Inet6Address was null

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static IPv6Address of(@Nonnull
                                      IPv6AddressWithMask network,
                                      @Nonnull
                                      MacAddress macAddress)
        Returns an IPv6Address object that represents the given MAC address in the specified network.

        The first (higher-order) 64-bit block of the returned address will be the network prefix derived from the specified network. The specified network must satisfy the followings:

        • isCidrMask() == true
        • 0 <= asCidrMaskLength() <= 64

        The second (lower-order) 64-bit block of the returned address will be equal to the Modified EUI-64 format interface identifier that corresponds to the specified MAC address.

        Refer to the followings for the details of conversions between MAC addresses and Modified EUI-64 format interface identifiers:

        • RFC 7042 - Section 2.2.1
        • RFC 5342 - Section 2.2.1 (Obsoleted by RFC 7042)
        • RFC 4291 - Appendix A
        Parameters:
        network - the IPv6 network
        macAddress - the MAC address
        Returns:
        an IPv6Address object that represents the given MAC address in the specified network
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified network does not meet the aforementioned requirements

      • ofCidrMaskLength

        @Nonnull
public static IPv6Address ofCidrMaskLength(int cidrMaskLength)
        Returns an IPv6Address object that represents the CIDR subnet mask of the given prefix length.
        Parameters:
        cidrMaskLength - the prefix length of the CIDR subnet mask (i.e. the number of leading one-bits), where 0 <= cidrMaskLength <= 128
        Returns:
        an IPv6Address object that represents the CIDR subnet mask of the given prefix length
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given prefix length was invalid

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns the raw IP address of this IPAddress object. The result is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getBytes()[0].

        Similar to InetAddress.getAddress()

        Specified by:

      • toInetAddress

        @Nonnull
public Inet6Address toInetAddress()
        Description copied from class: IPAddress
        Returns an InetAddress object representing this IP address.

        The resulting InetAddress object:

        • will not carry a hostname
        • will not carry a non-zero scope ID or scoped interface, in the case of Inet6Address
        Specified by:
        toInetAddress in class IPAddress<IPv6Address>
        Returns:
        an InetAddress object representing this IP address
